result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:25 PM Defendant Aleica May Springer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Aleica May Springer.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Status from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Status requested after defendant's release date. No objections from the State.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:05 pm.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 03:05 pm.

1:27 PM Defendant Aleica May Springer in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Aleica May Springer.  Attorney Christian J Ness in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case, cites appearances. Court provides Information filed. Parties acknowledge receipt. DE waives reading, not guilty plea entered. No speedy trial demand at this time. Off the record for scheduling.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:25 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 03:25 pm.

Mike Andrews, Agent
Polk Burnett Payee Inc, PO Box 577, Shell Lake WI 54871

1:32 PM Defendant Aleica May Springer in court, in custody.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Aleica May Springer. Court calls case and appearances. Parties are ready to proceed. State calls Deputy Warren Tuttle to the stand. Clerk swears in. State begins questioning. Record reflects the Deputy has identified the defendant. State continues. Nothing further. Cross from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Nothing further. Witness excused. Court takes note to certified bond filed. Argument from the parties. Court finds probable cause.
Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Aaron B Marcoux appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aleica May Springer appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Aleica May Springer. AA appears in person. VWC Fee appears in person. Court calls case, cites appearance. Court addresses scheduling. Motion for bond modification. AA makes statement in regards to contact with Def for purposes of the children. AA makes statement. DA Marcoux makes states position as to bond modification, no objection for communication for the purposes in regards to the children. AA makes request that he be allowed to have contact with AA. State has no objection to contact except in person. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes statement as to bond, communications would be through video. Requests court modify bond to no abusive contact with AA or her children. Court will amend bond to authorize no abusive contact with AA on the condition def remains in custody. Court reviews bond with DE.  Parties are not to discuss the case. Clerk to create bail modification. Next activity is on 4/25 at 1:30 p.m. for preliminary. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes request for monetary bond modifications, makes statement. State opposes any amendment to monetary conditions of the bond, makes statement. Court denies motion for amendment to monetary conditions of bond. Court makes statement. Bond to continue.

10:46 AM   Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Aleica May Springer. Defendant Aleica May Springer in court, in custody. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Set preliminary hearing. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

All conditions in previous bond in full force. Argument from Atty Otten.
